sorular.soru: Can you use hazard lights here?

feedback.metin: If you come to a standstill on the carriageway due to a breakdown and pose a possible danger to others, you should use a warning triangle. This may be replaced by or supplemented with hazard lights.

sorular.soru: Do you have to give right of way to the pedestrian?
cevaplar: Yes. Because the pedestrian is on the same road travelling straight on.
No. Pedestrians never have right of way.
No. Because there is no pedestrian crossing.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. Because the pedestrian is on the same road travelling straight on.

feedback.metin: The pedestrian is travelling in the opposite direction to you. You want to turn off, while the pedestrian wants to continue straight on. If you turn off, you must give right of way to all traffic travelling straight on, including pedestrians.

sorular.soru: The maximum authorised mass of the caravan is 800 kilograms. Which number plate belongs to the caravan?
cevaplar: Yellow, with a registration number not matching the towing vehicle.
White, with a registration number matching the towing vehicle.
Yellow, with a registration number matching the towing vehicle.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yellow, with a registration number not matching the towing vehicle.

feedback.metin: Caravans, trailers and semi-trailers with a maximum authorised mass of more than 750 kg must have a yellow number plate, with a unique own registration number. Caravans, trailers and semi-trailers with a maximum authorised mass up to 750 kg must have a white number plate with the same registration number as the towing vehicle.

sorular.soru: What do you do if this motorcycle wants to overtake you in a traffic jam?
cevaplar: In this lane, move carefully to the right.
Nothing. They are not allowed to pass the traffic jam.
In this lane, move carefully to the left.
sorular.dogruCevap: In this lane, move carefully to the right.

feedback.metin: Motorcyclists are allowed to overtake traffic jams. In doing so, they must comply with a number of rules of conduct, for example, that they may only pass the traffic jam between the two lanes on the left. Also, the speed difference with the traffic jam may only be up to a maximum of 10 km/h. To let the motorcyclist pass safely, you have to move to the right in this central lane.

sorular.soru: Can you turn on your hazard lights if you suddenly arrive at a traffic jam with stationary or slow-moving traffic?

feedback.metin: When you unexpectedly come across a traffic jam with stationary or slow-moving traffic, it is best to warn traffic behind you with your hazard lights. When you observe traffic behind you also using hazard lights, you can turn yours off.

sorular.soru: Which rules apply to snorfietsen?
cevaplar: The same rules that also apply to bicycles.
The same rules that also apply to mopeds.
The same rules that also apply to motor vehicles.
sorular.dogruCevap: The same rules that also apply to bicycles.

feedback.metin: The same rules apply to a snorfiets  as to a bicycle, unless the law provides otherwise.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to stop here to let someone into the car?

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to park your car next to a broken yellow line. But stopping to drop off or pick up passengers or to load and unload is allowed.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to enter this road?

feedback.metin: The C-2 sign indicates that this is a one-way street that is closed from this side to vehicles, horse riders and handlers of horses and livestock. The supplementary plate makes an exception for cyclists, snorfietsen, mopeds and speed pedelecs. You are not allowed to enter the road from this side in a passenger car.

sorular.soru: What should you expect here?
cevaplar: That you can continue driving as soon as the barriers go up.
That the traffic approaching from behind may not notice you in time.
That a second train can pass after the first one in the opposite direction.
sorular.dogruCevap: That a second train can pass after the first one in the opposite direction.

feedback.metin: The double Andreas crosses (sign J-13) show that this is a level crossing with two or more tracks. This means that after passing the first train, a second one can always follow in the opposite direction. In that case, the barriers can first go up, after which they immediately go down again. Always wait until the red lights are off before you drive.

sorular.soru: Can you still be a novice driver at age 36?

feedback.metin: Everyone obtaining their licence for the first time, is a novice driver for at least 5 years. It does not matter how old you are. Even at age 36, you can still be a novice driver if you obtained it after age 31.

sorular.soru: How can you save fuel with a car with an internal combustion engine?
cevaplar: By shifting up as late as possible.

feedback.metin: There are many ways to save fuel. But one of the most important ways, is by driving as evenly as possible. This means that you have to be able to 'absorb' the braking and acceleration of other traffic. You do this by maintaining a sufficient following distance. This way you do not have to brake and accelerate all the time. In addition, you start the car without accelerating, you shift up to a higher gear as early as possible when accelerating, you switch off the engine when you have to wait, you let the car roll out in the current gear when you have to stop, and you check the tyre pressure every month.

sorular.soru: What should you do if you are blinded by the full-beam headlights of an oncoming vehicle?
cevaplar: Warn them by flashing your full-beam headlights.
Warn them with your hazard lights.
Warn them with a sound signal.
sorular.dogruCevap: Warn them by flashing your full-beam headlights.

feedback.metin: Full-beam headlights are only allowed at night, but they must not obstruct other traffic. Using full-beam headlights during the day, when encountering other traffic, or when travelling behind other vehicles at a short distance is not allowed. If an oncoming vehicle is using full-beam headlights and blinds you, warn the driver by flashing your own full-beam.

sorular.soru: What is the speed limit on a normal road outside built-up areas?

feedback.metin: The speed limit on roads outside built-up areas is 80 km/h. On rural roads, there is often a reduced speed limit of 60 km/h. This is indicated by signs. Autoweg and motorway speed limits are also indicated by signs. On autowegen, the speed limit is 100 km/h and on motorways 130 km/h, unless signage indicates otherwise.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to park here?

feedback.metin: Parking on the right-hand side of the road is prohibited. You are allowed to park on the left-hand side of the road.

sorular.soru: Do pedestrians have right of way in an erf?

feedback.metin: Rules regarding right of way are the same in an erf as those for intersections outside of an erf. This means you are required to give way to all drivers approaching from the right. Pedestrians are not classed as drivers and therefore do not have right of way. Just as at other intersections, you are required to give pedestrians right of way if they are continuing ahead and you want to turn off, or if they are crossing an exit construction you want to drive in or out of. An important difference is that pedestrians in an erf are allowed to use the full width of the carriageway and you as a driver must anticipate children playing.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the tram?

feedback.metin: You should always give way to a tram unless you are on a priority road and the tram is not. The rule for through traffic on the same road does not apply to tram drivers either.

sorular.soru: What is the maximum length of a trailer including load?

feedback.metin: A trailer may be up to 12 metres long both without and with cargo. It does not matter whether that load is divisible or indivisible.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake here?

feedback.metin: A ban applies here for lorries to overtake motor vehicles. You can overtake here because the ban does not apply to you.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to reverse if you entered the road by mistake?

feedback.metin: This road is closed to all motor vehicles with more than 2 wheels. If you have entered the road by mistake, the best - and allowed - option is to reverse immediately.

sorular.soru: Are you in a 30 km-zone here?

feedback.metin: After passing the G-5 sign you are inside an erf. The roads within an erf are not meant for through traffic but have a residential function. There are often a lot of pedestrians and playing children. This is why drivers are not allowed to drive faster than 15 km/h within an erf.

sorular.soru: How many brake lights are mandatory on a passenger car?

feedback.metin: If you drive a passenger car in traffic, it must meet the legal requirements, which include three well-functioning brake lights.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive with a defective horn?

feedback.metin: A car must meet certain requirements according to the law, the permanent requirements. One of these requirements is a properly working horn with a fixed pitch.

sorular.soru: What do you do if a vehicle gets in lane too short in front of you?
cevaplar: Keep driving the same speed and warn them with light signals.
Let go of the accelerator and create a safe following distance.
sorular.dogruCevap: Let go of the accelerator and create a safe following distance.

feedback.metin: When someone gets in lane too short in front of you, you have to catch this mistake in a defensive way. This means, letting go of the accelerator and create a safe following distance immediately. Do not continue driving at the same speed and do not react in an aggressive manner. Besides that, braking harshly is not wise because this creates danger for the traffic behind you.

sorular.soru: Where will you see this sign?
cevaplar: If you enter a motorway from the wrong side.
If you enter a one-way street from the wrong side.
If you enter a bus lane from the wrong side.
sorular.dogruCevap: If you enter a motorway from the wrong side.

feedback.metin: The C-2 sign in combination with the "Go back" sign underneath is placed at the exit of autowegen or motorways for traffic travelling in the opposite direction. If you enter the exit from the wrong side, you will see this sign. You must then turn back as quickly as possible by turning or reversing.

sorular.soru: Your passenger car has broken down. Are you parked well?
cevaplar: No. You must park on the cycle path.
Yes, you are parked in the right place.
No. You must park as close to the cycle path as possible.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. You must park as close to the cycle path as possible.

feedback.metin: You are parked right next to the carriageway. This is unsafe and may inconvenience other drivers. If there is enough space, as in this situation, you must park your car more to the right.

sorular.soru: What is something you can always expect when exiting a tunnel during the day?
cevaplar: Your view worsens because of the sun.
The speed limit is often changed.
Your view improves because of the sun.
sorular.dogruCevap: Your view worsens because of the sun.

feedback.metin: When you exit a tunnel during the day, you can always expect that your view worsens because of the sunlight. Your eyes adjusted to the low light level inside the tunnel. As soon as you exit the tunnel, your eyes have to adjust to the much brighter light. By definition, the speed limit is not adjusted, this usually stays the same.

sorular.soru: What lighting is best to run when you have low sun from behind?

feedback.metin: Due to the low sun, oncoming traffic is blinded. So they will see you badly or not see you at all. To increase your visibility you run your dipped headlights.

sorular.soru: Should you expect the other car to brake?

feedback.metin: The car in front of you must give way to the pedestrian that keeps following the roundabout. It will therefore brake. Keep this in mind by starting to brake yourself.

sorular.soru: How many children of 1.40 metres tall are allowed to sit here?

feedback.metin: Children from 1.35 metres tall are allowed to sit in the vehicle without a child safety device. As this rear seat has two seats with a seat belt, only two passengers are allowed to sit here.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to reverse here?

feedback.metin: Sign D-4 (compulsory direction of travel) indicates that you are not allowed to turn right here. You may simply turn or reverse here. This sign is often confused with sign C-3: one-way street.

sorular.soru: What do you do when you are driving in a tunnel and there is a fire in front of you?
cevaplar: Park the car on the right, close the doors and take the keys with you, exit the tunnel.
Turn the car or exit the tunnel driving in reverse.
Park the car on the right, turn off the car, leave the keys in the ignition and exit the tunnel.
sorular.dogruCevap: Park the car on the right, turn off the car, leave the keys in the ignition and exit the tunnel.

feedback.metin: If a fire ignites in front of you when you are in a tunnel, you have to park your car as far to the right as possible. turn off the car and leave the keys in the ignition. This way, emergency services have the possibility to move your car in case they need more space. Alert emergency services and exit the tunnel as soon as possible via the emergency exit. Always follow the directions given by emergency services.

sorular.soru: Which parts of the road becomes extra slippery when is starts to freeze?

feedback.metin: Bridges and viaducts become extra slippery because the road surface also freezes from below. Shaded roads and sections in the shade, can also be slipperier than other roads and sections.

sorular.soru: Can the pedestrian go first?

feedback.metin: You must give way to pedestrians and disabled vehicles who are crossing or about to cross a pedestrian crossing. Moreover, you must reduce your speed in time so that the pedestrian knows you have seen them.

sorular.soru: What can you expect in this situation?
cevaplar: That the driver behind you is not paying attention.
That the driver behind you wants to overtake as soon as he gets a chance.
That the driver behind you is under the influence of alcohol.
sorular.dogruCevap: That the driver behind you wants to overtake as soon as he gets a chance.

feedback.metin: If a driver starts driving closely behind you and also against the road axis, you can assume they want to overtake you. Often there is not enough distance and he must therefore drive against the road axis to keep an eye on oncoming traffic. This is a dangerous situation but unfortunately happens often. If necessary, drive a little further to the right and do not accelerate if the vehicle wants to overtake you.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive like this, if the load does not interfere with shifting gears and steering?

feedback.metin: Because of the load, you do not have a clear view of your right wing mirror. Load may not obstruct the view in the wing mirrors. You also cannot check your blind spot on the right side this way. Driving like this is therefore not allowed.

sorular.soru: Your driving licence expired one month ago. Are you allowed to drive?

feedback.metin: You must be in possession of a valid driving licence B to drive a passenger car. A driving licence is valid until the date stated on the licence itself. After that date, the licence is considered expired and the driver is no longer allowed to drive. Driving licences are valid for 10 years, and can be renewed for a further 10 years at a time until the driver reaches the age of 65. After that time, renewal depends on the age of the driver.

sorular.soru: Which number plate is for a moped?

feedback.metin: Mopeds and speed pedelecs are equipped with a yellow number plate, while snorfietsen have a blue number plate. There is no green number plate for mopeds, snorfietsen or speed pedelecs.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake like this?

feedback.metin: You may not overtake if it is not safe to do so. In this case, overtaking would endanger the cyclist. There is far too little space.
